description: Retention and modification of floating pontoon (57m long and 2m wide) for a temporary period of 5 years

decision_conditions: The pontoon to which this permission relates shall be removed and the land shall be restored to its former condition on or before 30 September 2027.Reason: The development would be unacceptable on a permanent basis.

Within 6 months from the date of the permission hereby granted, a detailed Management Plan for the operational use of the pontoon shall be submitted to and agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The Management Plan shall include the following details:1) detail the operational arrangements for customer handover and procedures;  2) launch and return policy;3) measures to prevent queuing and obstruction the Riverside Walk;4) maximum number of boats; 5) liaison policy with other river user groups;6) management  and review of river safety issues;7) flood risk management procedures; 8) off-season safety and security;9) monitoring and review of safety and security measures. The development and associated activities shall operate in accordance with the approved Management Plan, with any additional mitigation measures identified by the Local Planning Authority being implemented within 8 weeks, or timescale as agreed with the Local Planning Authority.Reason: In the interests of the safety and operation of the waterway and pedestrian environment, in accordance with policies  Policies DM7 of the LDF Core Strategy (2012) and  K13 of the K+20 Kingston Area Action Plan.

The operational use of the pontoon by self-drive hire boats shall be restricted to GoBoat use only.Reason: The acceptability of the development is highly dependent upon the personal circumstances of the applicant, and in the interests of the safety and operation of the waterway and pedestrian environment, in accordance with policies  Policies DM7 of the LDF Core Strategy (2012) and  K13 of the K+20 Kingston Area Action Plan.

No more than 16 self drive hire boats shall operate from the pontoon, and no self drive hire boat launches or returns shall take place within 25 metres of the bridge.Reason: To prevent obstruction of the navigable width of the river, in accordance with Policies DM7 of the LDF Core Strategy (2012) K13  of the K+20 Kingston Area Action Plan, and Policy SI 16 of The London Plan (2021).

The development shall be completed in accordance with the following details which shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, within 3 months from the  date of this permission: (i) Scaled plan, clearly showing intended position of associated services and barriers (ii) Elevation of river wall clearly showing the position and number of the proposed fixings, in relation to river bank level and pontoon (iii) Detail (1:10) of proposed fixings, to confirm sizes in context of elevation(iv) Elevations and details of proposed means of enclosure for access management (rope barriers)(v) Sample of wooden decking including finish(vi) Details of colour and finish of powder coated finish to I-Beam(vii) Details of any associated signage(viii) service and utility details, including conduitsReason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions), Policy CS8 (Character, Heritage and Design) and Policy DM 12 (Development in Conservation Areas and Affecting Heritage Assets) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The modification to the pontoon, including reduction in  length and the installation of the timber decking, shall take place within 6 months of the date of the permission hereby granted.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The biodiversity measures contained within the Supplementary Supporting Statement dated September 2021 and  comprising 4 x underwater habitat 'cages,' as shown on the Biomatrix Water Solutions Ltd specification, shall be implemented in full within 6 months of the date of the permission hereby granted and retained thereafter.Reason: To safeguard the biodiversity and nature conservation value of the site, in accordance with policy G6 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS3 and DM6 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development shall be implemented in accordance with the detailed measures set out within the accompanying Flood Risk Assessment and Supplementary Flood Risk Assessment, prepared by Simon Jones-Parry.Reason: To mitigate the risks associated with flooding of the site, in accordance with policy SI12 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS1 and DM4 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.
